summary: Iodine is a chemical element with the symbol I and atomic number 53. It's a solid at room temperature, turning violet as a liquid and gas. Discovered in 1811, it was named after the Greek word for 'violet'. Iodine is essential for our health, helping make thyroid hormones. Lack of iodine can cause serious problems. Chile and Japan produce most of the world's iodine. It's also used in medicine and industry because it easily combines with other substances and isn't toxic. The World Health Organization considers iodine a vital medicine.
title: Iodine
